text: Eugene Charles Stringer (May 29, 1903 – June 1, 1985) was a professional American football player and a college football and college basketball coach. He played for one season for the Cleveland Bulldogs of the National Football League (NFL) in 1925. Stringer served as the head football coach (1926, 1930–1931) and head basketball coach (1926–1927, 1930–1932) at Saint Francis University in Loretto, Pennsylvania. ==References== Category:1903 births Category:1985 deaths Category:American football fullbacks Category:American football linebackers Category:Basketball coaches from Ohio Category:Cleveland Bulldogs players Category:John Carroll Blue Streaks football players Category:Saint Francis Red Flash football coaches Category:Saint Francis Red Flash men's basketball coaches Category:Sportspeople from Cleveland Category:Players of American football from Ohio
title: Eugene Stringer
